passages.text: Mainstreaming Sustainability: News & Content Highlights from Equity Research
Top of the Agenda...

Our 2025 EMEA Sustainable Investing 'Back to School' is out, highlighting the rise of a new generation of Article 8 funds, the widening transatlantic divide, and the emergence of 'sovereignty' as the new thematic darling. Link Follow the (EU) money: navigating climate funding under the Clean Industrial Deal. The latest edition of our Lost in Transition(s) series untangles the impact of the CID on public climate funding in the EU and highlights stocks that we consider to have the most favorable exposure. Link And also: The EU and the US agree to "exchange views" on CS3D & EUDR; NZBA suspends its activities; FCA investigates Drav's biomass sourcing disclosures; Norway's Northern Lights CCS project launches; and more.

Global Research Highlights | Policy & Regulatory Developments | Corporate & Industry | The Bigger Picture | Flows & Performance | Quote of the Week | Chart of the Week | Upcoming Events & Investor Access | Meet the Team | Sustainable Investing Discovery | Read our Research
See page 10 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures.

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
EMEA Sustainable Investing: 2025 EMEA Sustainable Investing Back to School - Raising to the Challenges of a New World Order (J. Hecker, H. Dubourg & N. de la Gorce)
EMEA Sustainable Investing: Catch me if you can: Navigating climate funding under the EU Clean Industrial Deal & stock implications (N. de la Gorce, J. Hecker & al.)
Global Sustainable Investing: The Sustainable Fixed Income Investor: Herding cats: a mini- primer on catastrophe bonds (V. Heriz)
UK Utilities: Orsted: Offshore Revolution Stalls, Testing Execution Demands (J. Garrido & al.)
US Clean Energy: Weekly Tearsheet; Global HVDC Deep Dive; GEV Investment; ENPH Safe Harbor Agreement (M. Strouse)
US Clean Tech: Weekly Highlights: July Charging Dashboard & More (B. Peterson)
Korea Equity Market: Sector Impact from the "Yellow Envelope Act" (S. Tsui & al.)

The EU and the US agree to "exchange views" on CS3D and EUDR, as part of their joint statement on transatlantic trade and investment. The Commission also indicated that the EU has "not committed to change CBAM in any specific way, nor to provide more favourable treatment to US companies under CBAM" or any other EU regulations. Responsible Investor
The EC is consulting on its proposal to revise state aid guidelines for corporates in difficulty, proposing to include new industries such as steel and certain innovative startups. EC
The EC is seeking input on the EU Electrification Action Plan and the EU Heating and Cooling Strategy, as part of the Clean Industrial Deal and the Action Plan for Affordable Energy. EC

Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has urged the court to dismiss lawsuits filed by Glass Lewis and ISS against new legislation, SB 2337, requiring proxy advisers to disclose if their advice includes ESG, DEI, social credit, or sustainability considerations. Attorney General

China is implementing a pilot program to ease restrictions on foreign capital for climate- related projects, allowing domestic non- financial firms in 16 provinces and major cities to borrow from non- residents in local and foreign currency. Bloomberg
China plans to tighten its carbon trading system by introducing absolute emissions caps starting in 2027, with the national carbon market expected to be fully established by 2030. Reuters
Amazon (OW- covered by D. Annuth) has formed a new strategic partnership to deploy advanced nuclear reactors to meet the increasing power demands of data centers and AI infrastructure. ESG Today
The UK's FCA is investigating Drax Group's (OW- covered by P. Mahbubani) biomass sourcing disclosures from January 2022 to March 2024, for allegedly misreporting biomass data. JPM
European carmakers claim the EU's planned combustion engine ban is unrealistic, urging policy- makers to revisit the planned phase- out. BNEF

Investors for Paris Compliance (I4PC) filed a complaint with the Alberta Securities Regulator (ASC) against Canadian energy firms Enbridge (OW- covered by J. Tonet) and Cenovus Energy (OW- covered by A. Jayaram), alleging misleading net- zero disclosures. Responsible Investor

Mitsubishi Corp. (Not Covered) announced that it will exit three offshore wind projects in Japan after incurring a \(52.2bn\) yen \((\) 354.31\mathrm{mn}\$ ) impairment due to a changed business environment and global cost overruns in offshore wind projects. Reuters

Norges Bank Investment Management has divested from U.S. machinery manufacturer Caterpillar (OW- covered by T. Zakaria) and five Israeli banks following an ethics committee finding links to the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. CNBC

Norway's Northern Lights CCS project, owned by Equinor (UW- covered by M. Lofting), Shell (OW- covered by M. Lofting), and TotalEnergies (OW- covered by M. Lofting), has started operations, storing CO2 from Heidelberg Materials' Brevik plant 2,600 meters below the seabed. CBS News
The Net- Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA) suspends its activities while proposing to its members to transition from a membership- based alliance to a new framework initiative. Responsible Investor

MSCI's latest report on "Do Commitments Matter" indicates that companies with SBTi- validate targets achieved a median annual reduction of \(0.5\%\) of their absolute scope 1 emissions between 2018 and 2023, while those without such targets experienced a \(4.3\%\) annual increase in average over the period. MSCI

Canbury's analysis reveals that Russell 1000 companies disclose against \(45\%\) of TCFD recommendations on average, with significant deficiencies in Scope 3 emissions reporting \((32\%)\) and climate scenario analysis \((11\%)\) . Canbury

The Anthropocene Fixed Income Institute (AFII) has urged the European Central Bank (ECB) to impose more significant haircuts on the debt of banks most exposed to climate risks, arguing that the ECB's current plan to apply climate- risk penalties to corporate bonds used as collateral "lacks ambition.". Politico

"Meeting CO2 targets for 2030 and 2035 is, in today's world, simply no longer feasible." European Automobile Manufacturers' Association President Ola Källenius and European Association of Automotive Suppliers President Matthias Zink

"For Europe to move towards a net- zero economy, our energy system must be powered by more secure home- grown clean electricity. Our plans to boost electrification and decarbonise heating and cooling will support industry, the buildings and mobility sectors in replacing the use of dirty fossil fuels with decarbonised energy at competitive prices. This is a win- win for the economy, and for the climate." Commissioner for Energy and Housing, Dan Jørgensen
Figure 1: Company Scope 1 emissions performance, by climate commitment type (median annualized change in absolute Scope 1 emissions, 2018-2023)
Source: MSCI, data as of June 30,2025
Figure 2: Difference in average corporate borrowing costs (basis points)
Analysis considers credit rating, duration liquidity and sector effects Source: MSCI, based on three years ending March 31,2025

Please join our European Equity Research Analysts and Sustainable Investing Analysts for a series of virtual meetings with handpicked European Companies. For compliance purposes, these calls are restricted to investors only.
- Air Liquide | Sept 16 | 15:00 UKT, 16:00 CET, 10:00 ET- RWE | Sept 18 | 14:00 UKT, 15:00 CET, 09:00 ET- SAP | Oct 29 | 14:00 UKT, 15:00 CET, 09:00 ET

The Sustainability Wire is our departmental publication curated by the EMEA Sustainable Investing Research team. It highlights reports from the Sustainable Investing team and those from our sector teams with a strong sustainability angle, alongside key sustainability- related newsflow, charts, quotes and upcoming investor access.
Should you wish to discuss any of the content in the EMEA Sustainability Wire, please reach out to the EMEA Sustainable Investing Team.
Explore analysts' views on sustainability related themes, guided by an AI driven materiality assessment.
Click here to access

- 340+ Active stock profiles across all key sectors- 1300+ Stock-specific comments jointly written by our Sustainability & Sector analysts- 25+ material Sustainability Themes inc. Climate Change, Biodiversity, Circular Economy, Board Effectiveness analysed

See our latest Research Library for a full list of published insights from our Sustainable Investing Specialists & Sector teams within EMEA Equity Research. The table below lists reports from the last six months.

Analyst Certification: The Research Analyst(s) denoted by an "AC" on the cover of this report certifies (or, where multiple Research Analysts are primarily responsible for this report, the Research Analyst denoted by an "AC" on the cover or within the document individually certifies, with respect to each security or issuer that the Research Analyst covers in this research) that: (1) all of the views expressed in this report accurately reflect the Research Analyst's personal views about any and all of the subject securities or issuers; and (2) no part of any of the Research Analyst's compensation was, is, or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed by the Research Analyst(s) in this report. For all Korea-based Research Analysts listed on the front cover, if applicable, they also certify, as per KOFIA requirements, that the Research Analyst's analysis was made in good faith and that the views reflect the Research Analyst's own opinion, without undue influence or intervention.

All authors named within this report are Research Analysts who produce independent research unless otherwise specified. In Europe, Sector Specialists (Sales and Trading) may be shown on this report as contacts but are not authors of the report or part of the Research Department.

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex- Australia and ex- India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
